alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 2:45PM MST until February 22 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations up to two inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. * WHERE...Boulder and the western suburbs of Denver. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 8 PM MST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from Midnight tonight to 9 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could result in hypothermia or frostbite if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow extra time to reach your destination. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org. The combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. If you go outside, cover all parts of your body, especially your head, face, and hands.
